title: Black ash
creator_contributor_role: Australia. Department of the Attorney-General, partner
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Wildfires - Australia
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Wildfires - Prevention and control
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural disasters
abstract: A personal account of the 'Black Saturday' bushfires of February 2009.
description: An account of a typical 'lazy day' by the river in Warburton which suddenly turns nasty when Bonnie and her friends realise the gravity of the fire. She recounts her anxiety and wanting to leave Warburton and her frustration at her family's indecisions. She is stuck in Lysterfield after they evacuate with 17 people.
